docs.lead_paragraph: Lauren Brooke Tabak, a daughter of Judy W. Tabak and Mark H. Tabak of Livingston, N.J., was married last evening to Jason Frederic Fass, the son of Robin E. Fass and Stephen H. Fass of Marlboro, N.J. Rabbi Irwin Kula officiated at Capitale, an event space in New York, with Rabbi Bernard S. Lipnick taking part.

docs.abstract: Two important articles co-authored by Peter Orszag, the director of the Congressional Budget Office. The first emphasizes a point I've also tried to get at: The long-term fiscal condition of the United States has been largely misdiagnosed. Despite all the attention paid to demographic challenges, such as the coming retirement of the baby-boom generation, our [...]

docs.lead_paragraph: Representative H. James Saxton, a 12-term New Jersey Republican, announced today that he would retire after next year rather than seek re-election. Mr. Saxton, who has been under attack by Democrats in recent weeks because of his opposition to the expansion of a children's health insurance program, is the 14th Republican this year to announce retirement from the House.

headline.main: N.J.'s Saxton to Retire From House

docs.abstract: The longtime Congressman cites his health in announcing that he's decided not to seek re-election, becoming the 14th House Republican to declare a desire to leave the House.
docs.snippet: The longtime Congressman cites his health in announcing that he's decided not to seek re-election, becoming the 14th House Republican to declare a desire to leave the House.

docs.lead_paragraph: One solution would be some form of universal health coverage for all Americans. Then uninsured veterans could get the care they need.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Senate dealt President Bush the first veto override of his presidency, with a resounding bipartisan vote to adopt a water bill.

headline.main: Congress Turns Back Bush’s Veto in  a Test of Power
headline.sub: Bush Is Dealt First Override as President;
headline.print_headline: Congress Turns Back Veto, Signaling a Test of Power

byline.contributor: Steven Lee Myers contributed reporting from San Antonio, and Carl Hulse from Washington.

docs.lead_paragraph: Amgen and Johnson & Johnson strengthened the label warnings for their anemia drugs, placing further emphasis on the risk of heart attacks, a worsening of cancer and death.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Senate voted today for a popular $23 billion water projects measure,  handing President Bush his first defeat in a veto showdown.
